results.summary: This section provides important notes and considerations for developers using Spin's relational database APIs, including handling PostgreSQL range queries and network permissions.

results.title: Granting Network Permissions to Components
results.summary: This section explains how to grant Spin components permission to make outgoing network requests, which is essential for database connectivity.

results.title: Configuration-Based Permissions
results.summary: This section discusses how to use application variables in the allowed outbound hosts field for granting network permissions, with a note on current limitations.

results.title: The Spin Redis trigger | Spin Docs
results.summary: The Spin Redis trigger allows applications to subscribe to pub-sub messages from a Redis instance, enabling asynchronous message processing. It provides a way to map Redis channels to components for handling messages effectively.

results.title: Specifying a Redis Trigger
results.summary: This section explains how to map a Redis channel to a component in Spin, allowing messages on that channel to be handled by the specified component. It also discusses the use of application variables in the configuration.

results.title: Setting a Default Server
results.summary: This part describes how to specify a default Redis server for all components in an application, simplifying the configuration process when multiple components listen to the same server.

results.title: Redis Trigger Authentication
results.summary: This section covers the authentication options for the Redis trigger in Spin, including the use of passwords in the Redis URL and future plans for secrets-based authentication.

results.title: Redis Components
results.summary: Spin runs Redis components using the WebAssembly component model, allowing for efficient message handling through various programming languages. This section outlines how to implement Redis components in different languages.

results.title: The Message Handler
results.summary: This section details how to implement message handlers for Redis components in various programming languages, providing code examples for Rust, Python, and Go.

results.title: Inside Redis Components
results.summary: This part explains the internal workings of Redis components in Spin, including the WebAssembly Interface (WIT) file and the required interface for Redis handlers.
